ratings.comment: It was one of toughest lecture I've ever taken. Professor's explanation is somewhat unclear. He explains difficult thing in a difficult way and loves mathematical notations which make even harder to understand. Discussion classes really help a lot, so go to discussion section.

Professor Penta definitely makes you work for it, but if you show up to class and do the problem sets (not graded), you'll do fine on tests.  He allows you to drop the lowest grade out of the three midterms AND the final.  Fast-paced class, but if you need help he'll readily answer questions.
You learn a lot but the material is very difficult.  Although homework and tests are difficult they grading isn't too bad

This is a difficult class! This guy really loves dense mathematical notation, sometimes to the detriment of clarity. Lectures are the typical econ PowerPoint routine, unfortunately. His lecture notes are pretty thorough, but I feel like he tried to cram too much stuff into one semester. Homework and exams are pretty reasonable. I'd take him again.

The material is not challenging, but the PACE makes the class very difficult. Penta does a great job explaining material during lecture, but be prepared for concepts to be explained mathematically. He curves the exams and it's definitely possible to pull off a good grade if you work hard.

Penta was easy to follow in lectures for the most part, but he is not very good at answering questions in class. Also, he frequently flips things around in equations and makes mistakes, which can make things SUPER hard to follow. If you take Penta, leave extra time studying to allow for being confused by his typos.
Extremely insightful lectures - sometimes hard to follow all the details (he is so damn smart and I am kind of slow), but do learn a lot by reading lecture notes and papers. Great class overall!
The class goes through all the material from micro and macro, so it's a fast paced class.  Prof. Penta is a really nice guy and always willing to help.  Plus, who doesn't like an Italian man?

I had him for Econ 111, which is the Honors version of macro and micro, taught at the same time. The pacing was pretty intense, but generally it was taught very well and he was always helpful in office hours. Only issue was occasional errors in problem sets and solutions. Also, he has a somewhat strong Italian accent but I had no trouble with it.
